intro: Palicourea alpina, commonly known as the alpine palicourea, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems that are often covered in a fine layer of hairs. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
